com.norconex.commons.lang.unit

Class DataUnitFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.norconex.commons.lang.unit.DataUnitFormatter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class DataUnitFormatter
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Formats a data unit as string. This class is thread-safe.
    Since:
    1.4.0
    Author:
    Pascal Essiembre
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataUnitFormatter()
      Creates a new DataUnit formatter with default system locale, without decimals.
      DataUnitFormatter(int decimalPrecision)
      Creates a new DataUnit formatter with default system locale with the maximum number of decimals returned when applicable.
      DataUnitFormatter(Locale locale)
      Creates a new DataUnit formatter without decimals.
      DataUnitFormatter(Locale locale, int decimalPrecision)
      Creates a new DataUnit formatter with the maximum number of decimals returned when applicable.
      DataUnitFormatter(Locale locale, int decimalPrecision, boolean fixedUnit)
      Creates a new DataUnit formatter with the maximum number of decimals returned when applicable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Object other) 
      String format(long amount, DataUnit unit)
      Formats a data amount of the given unit to a human-readable representation.
      int hashCode() 
      String toString()

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataUnitFormatter

        public DataUnitFormatter()
        Creates a new DataUnit formatter with default system locale, without decimals.

      • DataUnitFormatter

        public DataUnitFormatter(Locale locale)
        Creates a new DataUnit formatter without decimals. The decimal and thousand separator symbols are set according to supplied locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - a locale

      • DataUnitFormatter

        public DataUnitFormatter(int decimalPrecision)
        Creates a new DataUnit formatter with default system locale with the maximum number of decimals returned when applicable.
        Parameters:
        decimalPrecision - number of decimals

      • DataUnitFormatter

        public DataUnitFormatter(Locale locale,
                         int decimalPrecision)
        Creates a new DataUnit formatter with the maximum number of decimals returned when applicable. The decimal and thousand separator symbols are set according to supplied locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - a locale
        decimalPrecision - number of decimals

      • DataUnitFormatter

        public DataUnitFormatter(Locale locale,
                         int decimalPrecision,
                         boolean fixedUnit)
        Creates a new DataUnit formatter with the maximum number of decimals returned when applicable. The decimal and thousand separator symbols are set according to supplied locale. Set the fixedUnit to true to ensure the data units supplied are not change in the formatting.
        Parameters:
        locale - a locale
        decimalPrecision - number of decimals
        fixedUnit - true to keep original unit in formatting

    • Method Detail

      • format

        public String format(long amount,
                     DataUnit unit)
        Formats a data amount of the given unit to a human-readable representation.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to format
        unit - the data unit type of the amount
        Returns:
        formatted string
